Skip to contents
metapip 0.0.1
  • Reference
    • metapip in package development
    • package-specific-options
  • Changelog

Initializes the pip core packages

Source: R/init_metapip.R
init_metapip.Rd

Based on options() settings provides an option to download latest package versions from the branch

Usage

init_metapip(exclude = NA, ask = TRUE, answer = 1)

update_pip_packages(exclude = NA, ask = TRUE, answer = 1)

Arguments

exclude

character: packages to exclude from attaching. if [getwd] is one of the core PIP packages, that package will be excluded be default. To avoid that, set exclude to `NULL`.

ask

logical. Ask the user if she wants to install outdated packages. Default TRUE

answer

numeric: Developers argument. Only works for demonstration purposes.

Value

`init_metapip()` return invisible() output

`update_pip_packages()` return logical vector. TRUE if missing package were update. FALSE if all packages are up to date of the user selects not to update.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
  init_metapip()
} # }

update_pip_packages(ask = FALSE,
answer = 2) # this is to make it work in examples and vignettes.
#> ! The following packages do not have the updated version of default branch
